revised_title: Extraocular Muscle Afferents and Visual Processing in Pigeons
tldr: The authors investigated the effect of afferent signals from extraocular muscles on the visual responses of cells in the optic tectum of pigeons. They found that these signals can modify the visual responses of tectal cells in a directionally selective manner, suggesting that extraocular muscle afferent signals may be involved in the processing of visual information in the optic tectum.
